id: Allan Dell raring to go for Scotland after pulling back from brink of quitting
paragraph:
As he contemplates his first appearance at the Principality Stadium on Saturday, Allan Dell is surprisingly cheery and relaxed. It is a world away from six months ago when Scotland took on Wales and the loosehead prop was in “a dark place”, contemplating a future without rugby. Coming back from the Lions in 2017, he was diagnosed with two bulging discs in his spine, and then sustained a groin tear. Two operations in a week left him in constant pain and, consigned to almost a year on the sidelines, there were times when the 26-year-old seriously questioned whether his career had run its course.“It was tough,” he said. “It was a dark time.
